Question
========

Below is a cross tabulation of 80 workers' gender and the number of working hours per week (rounded to whole hours) are given.

  ------- ----------- ------------- ------------- ----------- < 18 hours 18 - 32 hours 33 - 36 hours > 36 hours male 1 7 14 8 woman 6 18 21 5 ------- ----------- ------------- ------------- -----------

The probability that a person randomly drawn from these workers will work less than 18 hours, *given* that it is a woman, is equal to

Answerlist
----------

* 0.075
* 0.12
* 0.51
* 0.857

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* 0.075: Incorrect
* 0.12: Correct
* 0.51: Incorrect
* 0.857: Incorrect
